content.question: An ideal monatomic gas is initially in State <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and undergoes a thermodynamic process. After the process, the gas is in State <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>. The graph shows the distribution of atomic speeds of the gas in states <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>. Which of the following correctly indicates whether the temperature of the gas increased or decreased, and provides a valid justification?

choices.label: Increased, because the average kinetic energy of the gas atoms increased
Increased, because number of gas particles increased
Decreased, because the average kinetic energy of the gas atoms decreased
Decreased, because the number of gas particles decreased

content.answer: Decreased, because the average kinetic energy of the gas atoms decreased
